title: X Factor Celebrity's Brendan Cole apologises to Max and Harvey for 'b****y' comment
text:

X Factor Celebrity contestant Brendan Cole has apologised to his co-stars Max and Harvey for making a "bitchy" comment about them during their performance.

The star-studded version of the TV talent show kicked off last night, with the contestants performing for the first time in front of the judges and their industry mates.

Brendan, who is in a duo called Edwards and Cole with pal Jeremy Edwards, was overheard slating the teenagers' social media following while watching them from backstage and he's now said sorry.

In a post on Twitter , he wrote: "It did sound very bitchy (shame on me) but make no mistake...

"You smashed your songs, ours one song was pants and your talent speaks for itself.

"I’m off with my tail between my legs and you are amazing! Soz boys! You are amazing."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Children's TV presenters-turned-pop stars Max and Harvey, both 16, were among those who took to the stage during last night's show.

While they were on stage, he was overheard slating the brothers after they made a comment about having eight million followers on social media.

He said: "They say they've got eight million across social media but the reality is they've only got a chunk on each, and it's all the same."

The comment sparked a fury among fans and has since been tweeted by the official X Factor account and the twins themselves.

The X Factor account shared a video of Brendan's comment, adding: "Who needs tanning lotion when @BrendanCole is bringing this shade! #XFactorCelebrity #XFactor."

(Image: ITV)

The twins then responded to the message by offering to give Brendan and Jeremy a boost by doing a social media post together.

They tweeted: "Hey @jqedwards @brendancole - there’s this app called Tik Tok where we have a lot of awesome fans!!! Maybe we can make a post on there together sometime?"

The sweet message prompted Brendan to apologise for his remark, and add: "I don’t know what you just said but ok!"
